snippet: Two prominent scientists involved have surrendered more than 3,000 of their private e-mails to BP in response to a subpoena by the United States District Court in New Orleans.
abstract: Chris Reddy and Richard Camilli, scientists involved in estimating the flow rate from a ruptured oil well during BP’s 2010 oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico, have surrendered more than 3,000 of their private e-mails to the company in response to a federal subpoena; BP sought the e-mails to help prepare its defense in a lawsuit brought by the federal government.
lead_paragraph: Two prominent scientists involved have surrendered more than 3,000 of their private e-mails to BP in response to a subpoena by the United States District Court in New Orleans.

headline.main: Louisiana: Two Scientists Surrender E-Mail to BP
